347.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Monday said he has informed the DGP to grant leave for one day to all police personnel in the state to watch Vivek Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files', whenever they choose to do so with their families. This comes after CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Sunday declared 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free in the state.

348.title: 10 humanitarian corridors to operate today: Ukraine Deputy PM
348.article_body: Ukraine's Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk has said that the country will try to evacuate trapped civilians through 10 humanitarian corridors that have been agreed upon for today. She added that civilians in towns near Kyiv and in eastern Luhansk will be able to use them. Earlier, Ukraine President said that 1.25 lakh people have been evacuated via humanitarian corridors.

349.title: Ukraine finish second behind China in 2022 Winter Paralympic medal count
349.article_body: Ukraine finished second in the 2022 Winter Paralympics in Beijing. Ukraine won 11 gold medals, 10 silver medals and eight bronze medals. China finished first with 18 gold medals and a total of 61 medals. Ukrainian athletes were the last delegation to arrive in Beijing because of logistical challenges caused by Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

350.title: Rishabh Pant has backed his strengths, he's learning: Jasprit Bumrah
350.article_body: India pacer Jasprit Bumrah said the team will help Rishabh Pant go forward with the tempo he likes to play at. "You can't teach everyone to play in the same manner. Pant has backed his strengths...he's [also] learning a lot and getting experience," he added. Pant smashed the fastest Test fifty by an Indian in the ongoing Sri Lanka Test.

351.title: India's wholesale inflation rises to 13.11% in February 2022
351.article_body: Wholesale inflation in India rose 828 basis points YoY from 4.83% in February 2021 to 13.11% in February 2022, as per Commerce Ministry's data. Wholesale inflation was at 12.96% in January 2022. The Ministry said high inflation in February was caused by rising prices of mineral oils, metals, crude petroleum, natural gas and food articles, among other commodities.

352.title: 'I'm done being quiet, grow the f*** up,' says Pete to Kanye; pics of chat surface
352.article_body: Screenshots of a text exchange between Kanye and Pete Davidson have surfaced in which Pete purportedly said, "I'm done being quiet. Grow the f*** up." Pete also said, "Kim (Kardashian) is the best mother I've ever met...You're so f****** lucky that she's your kids' mom." This came after Kanye claimed that his children weren't allowed to go to Sunday service.

353.title: 4 booked for entering B'luru stadium to take selfie with Virat Kohli
353.article_body: Four people, including two minors, have been booked for criminal trespassing after they ran onto the Bengaluru cricket stadium and tried taking a selfie with Virat Kohli on Sunday. They had trespassed into the playing area during a break at a match between India and Sri Lanka. The players continue to be in a bio bubble due to COVID-19 restrictions.

354.title: Virat said 'It's okay, you can fail': Harshal on 37-run joint-worst over in IPL history
354.article_body: Recalling his 37-run over against CSK last season, which is also the joint-worst over in IPL's history, RCB pacer Harshal Patel said, "Virat came up to me and said, 'You got hit...it happens. [When] you put yourself in difficult situations, you can [sometimes] fail'." Harshal added that Virat understands the "pressure situations" and has been very supportive of him.

355.title: Germany to buy F-35 fighter jets capable of carrying nuclear bombs: Report
355.article_body: Germany is planning to purchase F-35 fighter jets to replace its Tornado aircraft, according to a Reuters report quoting government sources. The country is reportedly looking to buy up to 35 stealth jets. Manufactured by US firm Lockheed Martin, the jets are capable of carrying nuclear bombs. Notably, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz recently announced an increase in defence spending.

356.title: Ex-NSE CEO Ramkrishna sent to 14-day judicial custody in co-location scam
356.article_body: A Delhi court on Monday sent former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna to 14-day judicial custody in the co-location case. Ramkrishna, who has been accused of sharing confidential information with a 'Himalayan yogi', was arrested by the CBI a few days back. Earlier, CBI had demanded 14-day custody of Ramkrishna saying that she had been "evasive in her replies".

357.title: Will Smith, Jessica Chastain win best actor awards at Critics Choice Awards
357.article_body: Actor Will Smith won the Best Actor award and Jessica Chastain bagged the Best Actress award at the 2022 Critics Choice Awards on Sunday. While Smith won the award for the film 'King Richard', Chastain was awarded for her performance in 'The Eyes of Tammy Faye'. The award for Best Picture went to 'The Power of the Dog'.

358.title: Won't comment, don't want to become gossip: Jubin on dating Nikita
358.article_body: Singer Jubin Nautiyal, on being asked if he is dating actress Nikita Dutta, said that he won't like to comment as they don't want to become the subject of gossip. The two sparked dating rumours after being spotted together in Mumbai's Juhu. "Nikita and I were just hanging out at a cafe in Juhu for some time," Jubin added.

359.title: Tara to star in 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad's thriller 'Apurva': Reports
359.article_body: Actress Tara Sutaria has signed on to star in 'Kabir Singh' producer Murad Khetani's women-centric film titled 'Apurva', as per reports. The upcoming thriller is expected to be a small-budget project. 'Apurva' will reportedly be directed by Nikhil Bhat, who helmed the show 'The Gone Game'. Tara will also be seen sharing screen space with Tiger Shroff in 'Heropanti 2'.

360.title: Vanced app, which blocks YouTube ads, to shut down over 'legal reasons'
360.article_body: YouTube Vanced app, which lets users block ads on YouTube without Premium subscription, is shutting down "due to legal reasons". According to The Verge, Google had sent the Vanced owners a cease and desist letter recently. "We were asked to remove all references to 'YouTube', change the logo, and remove links related to YouTube," the Vanced team told The Verge.

361.title: Don't be afraid: Sea's secretive billionaire CEO to staff on tech firm losing $150 bn value
361.article_body: Forrest Li, the 44-year-old secretive billionaire CEO of Singapore-based technology firm Sea Ltd, which owns e-commerce platform Shopee, mobile game Garena Free Fire among other businesses, wrote a 900-word memo to his employees. The memo addressed a $150-billion plunge in his company's value since late 2021. He wrote, "This drop is painful...Do not fear: We're in a strong position internally."

362.title: I'm here for all witches: Emma seemingly criticises JK Rowling at BAFTA
362.article_body: Actress Emma Watson, who presented an award at the BAFTA Awards 2022, was introduced as a witch for her Harry Potter character Hermione Granger. Emma came to the podium and stated, "I am here for all of the witches." A social media user commented, "Sly lil dig at JK Rowling there, Emma Watson?" while another wrote, "What a QUEEEEENNN."

363.title: Kashmiri Pandits' plight an outcome of Nehruvian blunders: Union Minister
363.article_body: Days after release of 'The Kashmir Files' movie, Union Minister Jitendra Singh blamed the Congress party for the plight of Kashmiri Pandits who were forced to leave the valley. "History [is] witness to the fact that all this was a cumulative outcome of a series of Congress blunders beginning from what's now recorded as infamous Nehruvian blunders," said Singh.

364.title: Snares to catch peacocks found on hills near Pune village
364.article_body: Forest department officials are monitoring the situation after people found snares to catch peacocks on hills near a village in Pune's Hinjewadi. Hunting and killing of peacocks, which is India's National Bird, is prohibited by law and carries a sentence of up to seven years in jail, an activist said. Residents have been warned about the traps, the activist added.

365.title: Delhi fountain partially closed, PWD says 'tipplers wanted to take shower'
365.article_body: The public works department in Delhi has partially closed the fountains on the stretch along the Old BRT corridor from Chirag Dilli FOB to Sheikh Sarai corridor. "Tipplers used to come during night...take selfies, sing songs and dance along the stretch...they wanted to take a shower...or wash their faces in it...they even misbehaved with security guard," a PWD official said.

366.title: iPhone supplier Foxconn halts production in China's Shenzhen amid COVID-19 curbs
366.article_body: Apple iPhone supplier Foxconn on Monday said that it has suspended operations until further notice in China's Shenzhen city after authorities imposed lockdown measures in the tech hub city amid rising COVID-19 cases. Foxconn added it would deploy backup plants to reduce the disruption to production. On Sunday, China reported over 3,000 new daily cases, its highest in two years.

367.title: Son Junaid was rejected for Mira Nair's 'A Suitable Boy': Aamir
367.article_body: Aamir Khan has revealed that his son, Junaid Khan, went for a screen test for Mira Nair's 'A Suitable Boy' but was not selected. "He never mentioned to anyone that he was my son...He made his own journey. He learnt theatre, he did plays, he got rejected from 15-20 places," Aamir added. Junaid will make his debut with YRF's 'Maharaja'.

368.title: Class 12 Chemistry paper wasn't leaked, false propaganda being spread: Maha minister
368.article_body: Maharashtra School Education Minister Varsha Eknath Gaikwad has clarified that the Class 12 Chemistry paper of state board was not leaked. Gaikwad added that "false propaganda" is being spread through social media. This comes after reports claimed the paper was leaked hours ahead of the exam. Earlier on Monday, a coaching centre's owner was arrested in Mumbai in this connection.

369.title: SA record their highest successful chase in Women's WC history, win 3 matches in a row
369.article_body: South Africa chased down a target of 236 against defending champions England to register their highest successful chase in Women's World Cup history. South Africa's previous highest successful chase in Women's World Cup had come in 2017, when they chased down a target of 207 against Pakistan. South Africa have now won three straight matches in 2022 Women's World Cup.

370.title: COVID vaccine for 12-14 age group, booster dose for everyone above 60 from Mar 16: Govt
370.article_body: Health Minister Dr Mansukh Mandaviya today announced COVID-19 vaccination of children in age group of 12 to 14 will begin from March 16. He further said that everyone aged 60-plus will now be able to get precaution doses. He wrote, "I urge the families of children and people in the age group of 60-plus that they must get the vaccine."

371.title: Tharoor shares selfie with AAP's Mann, calls it 'parliamentary camaraderie'
371.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor on Monday posted a selfie with Punjab CM-designate Bhagwant Mann. Sharing the picture, Tharoor wrote, "Parliamentary camaraderie...I had the pleasure of sharing his joy after five years of being seated on the same bench in the Lok Sabha in the previous term." A user commented, "This is how we want...parliamentarians across the party lines to be."

372.title: Warden of children's home in TN arrested after minor boys allege sexual abuse
372.article_body: The 36-year-old warden of a children's home in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvannamalai was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing minor boys residing at the home for past three months. Seven minor boys had reportedly called children's helpline number 1098 to report the crime. The home's owner was also arrested for neither reporting the alleged crime nor taking action against it, police said.

373.title: I gave all my time to work, forgot my family was waiting for me: Aamir Khan
373.article_body: Actor Aamir Khan said that he has given all his time to his work and that he thought that his family was with him anyway. "I just wanted to win the hearts of the audience at the time. And, I got completely lost, so much so that I forgot my family was waiting for me," Aamir said.

374.title: Centre allows Sikh passengers to wear kirpan on Indian flights
374.article_body: Civil Aviation Ministry has modified an earlier order restricting Sikh passengers from wearing kirpan on flights and allowed them to do so on an "Indian aircraft within India". Kirpan's total length shouldn't exceed 22.86 cm, it said. BJP leader Manjinder Singh Sirsa shared the corrigendum's picture and thanked PM Narendra Modi and Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia for their "swift action".

375.title: Hard to digest: Pak captain Maroof on their 4th straight loss in Women's WC
375.article_body: Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof expressed disappointment after they suffered their fourth straight loss in the ongoing Women's ODI World Cup. "Very hard to digest. Some bad shots from the middle-order cost us the game [against Bangladesh]," she stated. Meanwhile, Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana said she can't even describe the feeling after registering their first-ever win in Women's World Cup.

376.title: AirAsia's Bengaluru-Kolkata flight makes emergency landing in Bhubaneswar, man dies
376.article_body: An AirAsia Bengaluru-Kolkata flight made an emergency landing at Biju Patnaik International Airport in Bhubaneswar after a passenger fell ill mid-flight on Sunday morning. The airport authorities dispatched an ambulance ahead of time to transport the patient to the hospital. However, the passenger could not be saved and was declared dead at the Capital Hospital.

377.title: Unattended bag inside Delhi-bound train triggers bomb scare; bomb squad called
377.article_body: A fire was reported in a train travelling to Delhi from Haryana. An unattended bag, a pouch and a container were found inside a coach. Police said the pouch containing about 2 kilograms of nails had caught fire due to friction. A bomb disposal squad reached the spot after getting information. Police claimed the bag may belong to a carpenter.

378.title: There has been improvement in Pant's method: Irfan Pathan
378.article_body: Praising wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant, Irfan Pathan said there has been improvement in the 24-year-old's method. "Earlier, Pant used to play shots only on the leg side but now plays shots on the off-side as well...He now tries to find a way to stay on the pitch, doesn't only hit," added Irfan. Pant scored 185 runs in two Sri Lanka Tests.

379.title: Ukraine Prez meets injured soldiers in hospital, hands them medals
379.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday visited a military hospital in Kyiv to meet injured soldiers and handed them medals for their service to the country. A video of Zelenskyy interacting with the soldiers has been shared online. "Guys, get well soon. I believe that the best gift for your statement will be our common victory!" Zelenskyy said.

380.title: Nothing like that: Kartik on being asked if someone in B'wood is 'harassing' him
380.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan, during his interaction with media at the Iconic Gold Awards 2022, was asked if someone in Bollywood was 'harassing' him. "There is nothing like that. Nobody is bothering me," he said. Kartik was reportedly fired from Dharma Productions' 'Dostana 2' last year due to 'unprofessional behaviour'. Kartik will be next seen in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

381.title: Pregnant Ukrainian woman whose rescue pic was shared widely dies in another Russian attack
381.article_body: A pregnant woman and her baby have died after Russia bombed the maternity hospital where she was meant to give birth. Earlier, photos of the woman being rushed to an ambulance on a stretcher were widely shared worldwide. Realising that she was losing her baby, she cried out to medics, "Kill me now!" Both she and her baby later died.

382.title: Bangladesh win a Women's World Cup match for the first time, defeat Pakistan
382.article_body: Bangladesh defeated Pakistan by nine runs to register their first-ever victory in a Women's World Cup match. Fargana Hoque top-scored as Bangladesh put up a total of 234/7. Pakistan were restricted to 225/9 despite Sidra Ameen's 104(140). Bangladesh's Fahima Khatun picked up three wickets. Pakistan have lost each of their first four 2022 Women's World Cup matches so far.

383.title: 2 boys hold poster reading 'Rohit is not my captain, reinstate Kohli', pic goes viral
383.article_body: A picture has gone viral on social media showing two boys holding a poster reading 'Rohit is not my captain, reinstate Kohli' during India-Sri Lanka Day-Night Test at M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. After facing criticism from a certain section of fans, the boys' father tweeted, "Guys relax...that was for Tests only...Rohit is no doubt 'GOAT' in white-ball cricket."

384.title: Request to wear yellow turbans, shawls for swearing-in ceremony: Mann
384.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party's Bhagwant Mann, who will take oath as the Chief Minister of Punjab on March 16 requested public to reach Khatkar Kalan for the ceremony. "I request my brothers to wear yellow turbans that day and sisters to drape yellow shawls/stoles. We will colour Khatkar Kalan in 'Basanti rang' that day," he added.

385.title: 7 killed in fire at chemical plant in China
385.article_body: As many as seven people were reportedly killed after a fire broke out at a chemical plant in China on Monday. The accident occurred during some maintenance activity at Bao Gang United Steel plant in the country's Inner Mongolia region. After reaching the site, the rescue team found that seven people were missing, all of whom were later found dead.

386.title: 'Pushpa' actress Rashmika in talks for a song in Ranbir's 'Animal': Reports
386.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna, who was recently seen in 'Pushpa: The Rise', is reportedly in talks for a special song in 'Animal', an upcoming action film starring Ranbir Kapoor. It will be directed by 'Kabir Singh' fame director Sandeep Reddy Vanga and will also feature Parineeti Chopra, Bobby Deol and Anil Kapoor. 'Animal' is expected to release on August 11, 2023.

387.title: At least 596 civilians killed since Russia attacked Ukraine
387.article_body: The Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights said that at least 596 civilians including 43 children have been killed in Ukraine since Russia's attack. The number of those injured stood at 1,067 including 57 children, it added. Most of the casualties were caused by the use of explosive weapons including shelling, missiles and airstrikes, it said.

388.title: I still own & won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge: Elon Musk
388.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "I still own and won't sell my Bitcoin, Ethereum or Doge." However, he added, "As a general principle...It's generally better...to own physical things like a home or stock in companies you think make good products...than dollars when inflation is high." Bitcoin, Ether and Doge prices saw a brief spike after Musk's tweet.

389.title: Had Emirati wedding with Rubina in Abu Dhabi: Abhinav Shukla on 'Wanderlust'
389.article_body: Actor Abhinav Shukla, while talking about series 'Wanderlust' said that he had an Emirati wedding with his wife and actress Rubina Dilaik in Abu Dhabi. "We were dressed like the local...groom and the bride. And we were, we are a very close experience of how it would be locationally...getting married...in that style...that was memorable," Abhinav added.

390.title: ITBP official martyred, head constable injured in IED blast in Chhattisgarh
390.article_body: An official of the Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) was martyred and a head constable suffered injuries when a pressure improvised explosive device (IED) planted by Naxals exploded in Chhattisgarh's Narayanpur on Monday, police said. The incident took place when a team of ITBP's 53rd battalion was out on patrolling duty to ensure security to a road construction work, police added.

391.title: PM Modi is a man of tremendous vigour and dynamism: Shashi Tharoor
391.article_body: Congress' Shashi Tharoor said PM Narendra Modi is a man of "tremendous vigour and dynamism". "The PM has done some things which are very impressive, especially politically. We didn't expect him to win with such great margins, but he did," he said. "The Indian voter has the capacity to surprise...but right now they've given BJP what they wanted," Tharoor added.

392.title: I love Jadeja's game among the new cricketers: Kapil Dev
392.article_body: Ex-India captain Kapil Dev has said he loves all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's game among the new cricketers. "Jadeja plays without pressure. He enjoys cricket. That's why he's good at bowling as well as batting. He also does a great job in fielding," stated Kapil. Jadeja smashed unbeaten 175 and picked a total of nine wickets in first Test against Sri Lanka.

393.title: 35-yr-old man charred to death after car catches fire in Bengaluru
393.article_body: A 35-year-old man was charred to death after his car accidentally caught fire on Bengaluru's NICE Road, police said. According to police, the man had pulled his car to a side and was trying to get out after he noticed the fire in the AC vent. A passerby had rushed to help the deceased when the car exploded, police added.

394.title: Taiwan's fighter jet crashes into sea; second incident in 3 months
394.article_body: A Taiwanese fighter jet crashed into the sea off its southeast coast, said the presidential office on Monday. The French-built Mirage 2000 aircraft was on a training mission from the Chihhang air base in Taitung. The pilot was reported to be safe after parachuting out of the crashing plane. In January, an F-16 jet crashed, killing the pilot.

395.title: A top industrialist asked me to sleep with his wife at my nightclub: Tehseen Poonawalla
395.article_body: Venture Capitalist and political analyst Tehseen Poonawalla, revealed in the reality show 'Lock Upp', that a top industrialist once asked him to sleep with his wife. "He booked my entire nightclub for [weekend]. His condition was that he wanted to see me sleeping with his wife." Tehseen further said that he did it as the industrialist watched.

396.title: Delhi Police personnel save 20-year-old law student who jumped into Yamuna river
396.article_body: Three Delhi Police personnel jumped into Yamuna river to save a 20-year-old law student who tried to kill himself after failing in one of his exams. The student belongs to Rajasthan's Alwar and studies at National Law School of India University, Bengaluru. Officials said Alwar police informed that a man will try to kill himself as he tweeted about it.

397.title: 15 arrested after several men sexually assault women in MP as onlookers recorded videos
397.article_body: As many as 15 people, including the prime accused, have been arrested after several men sexually assaulted two women on a street during the Bhagoria festival in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur. A video had surfaced online showing the men molesting the women one by one as onlookers recorded videos on their phones.

398.title: Maha board's Class 12 Chemistry paper leaked; coaching centre owner arrested
398.article_body: The Class 12 chemistry paper of Maharashtra State Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education has allegedly been leaked in Mumbai. Police in Vile Parle have arrested a teacher, who is the owner of a coaching centre in Malad, in connection with the paper leak. The accused allegedly shared the paper on a WhatsApp group before the exam, police said.

399.title: 6.7-magnitude earthquake hits Indonesia's Sumatra; no casualties reported
399.article_body: An earthquake of 6.7 magnitude struck Indonesia's Sumatra island on Monday prompting residents to flee homes. The epicentre was located at about 167 km from the coastal city of Pariaman, as per US Geological Survey. No loss of life or other damages were reported. The authorities initially warned of a potential tsunami but later lifted the warning.

400.title: Bees attack 200 tourists at Pune's Shivneri Fort, 25 hospitalised
400.article_body: At least 200 tourists were stung by bees at Shivneri Fort in Pune on Sunday. State forest department officials said that at least 25 tourists were hospitalised and discharged after primary treatment at a local government hospital. "Swarms of bees from at least three beehives located near the main entrance of the fort were galvanised," an official said.

401.title: Paytm shares fall to all-time low of ₹672 after RBI curbs on Paytm Payments Bank
401.article_body: The shares of Paytm fell more than 12% to hit an all-time low of ₹672 on the BSE in Monday's early deals. This comes after Reserve Bank of India (RBI) barred Paytm Payments Bank from onboarding new customers until its audit is done. The stock has declined around 70% compared to its issue price of ₹2,150 per share.

402.title: It's not just attack, attack, there's a lot of method to it: Jaffer on Pant's batting
402.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said there's a lot of method to Rishabh Pant's attacking batting. "Pant comes out and attacks...he puts the (opposition) team on the back foot, and then he plays the waiting game and then surprises with his attacking shots," Jaffer explained. Pant smashed the fastest fifty by an Indian in Tests while playing against Sri Lanka.
